answers.answer: Hi EddieYou should prepare 1/3 of the meal and offer it to your dog, once gone, inject the insulin then feed the remaining 2/3 of the mealYou can substitute homemade meals for whatever type of dog food you are feeding like chicken and vegetables for example.I hope this is helpful and if you'd like to discuss further please call my veterinary office toll free at 866 372 2765 as I am glad to help further.Thank youDr Carol Osborne, DVM
Nice to see a Vet reading the boards.  I have little experience with diabetes so good information to read.

question: My dog is diabetic and will not eat the prescribed food. How long should I make it available for her to eat. She cannot have a shot unless she eats a full meal.
title: diabetic female
